description: Borrowed from Medieval Latin bahobab, from Arabic أَبُو حِبَاب‎ (ʔabū ḥibāb, “father of many seeds”), from أَبُو‎ (ʔabū, “father”) + حَبّ‎ (ḥabb, “seed”).

entries.meaning: A tree, Adansonia digitata (and similar species), native to tropical Africa, having a broad swollen trunk and edible gourd-like hanging fruits.
examples: Synonyms: cream of tartar tree, sour gourd
